content: अवभृथः [अव-भृ-क्थन् <ls>Uṇ. 2. 3</ls>] {@--1@} The end or completion of a principal sacrifice. {@--2@} Bathing at the end of a principal sacrifice for purification; नावभृथं सरस्वत्यां <ls>Kāty.</ls>; भुवं कोष्णेन कुंडोध्नी मेध्येनावभृथादपि <ls>R. 1. 84</ls>; प्रीत्याश्वमेधावभृथार्द्रमूर्तेः <ls n="R.">6. </ls>; <ls n="R.">9. 22</ls>; <ls n="R.">11. 31</ls>; <ls n="R.">13. 61</ls>; <ls>Y. 3. 244</ls>; <ls>Ms. 11. 83.</ls> {@--3@} Purification by bathing of the sacrificer and the sacrificial vessels at the end of a sacrifice. {@--4@} The water of purification. {@--5@} A supplementary sacrifice to atone for defects in a principal and preceding one; a sacrifice in general; स्नातवत्यवभृथे ततस्त्वयि <ls>Śi. 14. 10.</ls>
